text.div:
Narrativa gerada: ConceptMap ConceptMapSleepToOMOP

Mapeamento de (não especificado) para (não especificado)


Grupo 1 Mapeamento de Logical Observation Identifiers, Names and Codes (LOINC) to OHDSI OMOP CDM Concepts (External Reference)

Código fonteRelacionamentoCódigo de destinoComentário
93832-4 (Sleep duration)is equivalent to40771110 (Sleep duration)VERIFIED OMOP mapping for sleep duration. - OMOP concept_id: 40771110 - Domain: Measurement - Unit_concept_id: 8505 (hour) or 8550 (minute) - Recommended: 7-9 hours for adults (AASM guidelines)
28323-4 (Sleep quality)(not mapped)Sleep quality assessment. No direct OMOP concept. Can be represented via: - PSQI score (Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index) - Vendor-specific sleep scores (Oura, WHOOP) Store in measurement_source_value with context.
93831-6 (Sleep efficiency)(not mapped)GAP: Sleep efficiency has no OMOP concept. Formula: (Total Sleep Time / Time in Bed) × 100 Normal: >85% Unit: percentage (%) Critical metric for insomnia assessment.
93829-0 (Sleep onset latency)(not mapped)GAP: Sleep onset latency has no OMOP concept. Time from lights out to sleep onset. Normal: <30 minutes Prolonged latency indicates insomnia. Unit_concept_id: 8550 (minute)
93830-8 (Number of awakenings during sleep)(not mapped)Number of wake episodes during sleep period. Normal: <5 brief awakenings.

Grupo 2 Mapeamento de https://2rdoc.pt/ig/ios-lifestyle-medicine/CodeSystem/sleep-metrics-cs to OHDSI OMOP CDM Concepts (External Reference)

Código fonteRelacionamentoCódigo de destinoComentário
deep-sleep (Deep Sleep Duration (SWS))(not mapped)Slow Wave Sleep (N3) duration. Normal: 15-25% of total sleep (1-2 hours) Critical for physical restoration, memory consolidation. Most important sleep stage for recovery.
rem-sleep (REM Sleep Duration)(not mapped)Rapid Eye Movement sleep duration. Normal: 20-25% of total sleep (1.5-2 hours) Critical for cognitive function, emotional regulation. Dreaming occurs primarily in REM.
light-sleep (Light Sleep Duration)(not mapped)Light sleep (N1 + N2) duration. Normal: 50-60% of total sleep Transition and lighter restorative sleep.
sleep-score (Sleep Score (Vendor Composite))(not mapped)Vendor-specific composite sleep score (0-100). Combines duration, efficiency, stages, HRV during sleep. Examples: Oura Sleep Score, WHOOP Sleep Performance, Fitbit Sleep Score. Non-standardized but clinically used.
waso (Wake After Sleep Onset)(not mapped)Total time awake after initial sleep onset. Normal: <30 minutes Elevated WASO indicates sleep maintenance insomnia. Unit_concept_id: 8550 (minute)

name: ConceptMapSleepToOMOP
title: Sleep Metrics to OMOP CDM Mapping
description:
Maps sleep metrics from wearables to OMOP CDM concepts for federated analytics.

Sleep as Lifestyle Medicine Pillar:
- Sleep duration: 7-9 hours recommended for adults (AASM)
- Sleep efficiency: >85% considered normal
- Sleep stages: Light, Deep (SWS), REM proportions
- Sleep quality: Validated via PSQI, ISI questionnaires

Target OMOP Table: MEASUREMENT
- measurement_concept_id: mapped OMOP concept
- value_as_number: sleep metric value
- unit_concept_id: varies by metric
- measurement_type_concept_id: 44818707 (Patient self-reported/device)

Supported Sleep Trackers:
- Oura Ring (Gen 3)
- WHOOP 4.0
- Apple Watch (watchOS sleep tracking)
- Fitbit (Sleep Score)
- Garmin (Advanced Sleep Monitoring)
- Polar (Sleep Plus Stages)
purpose: Enable ETL transformation of sleep wearable data from FHIR to OMOP CDM for sleep research, circadian rhythm studies, and lifestyle medicine interventions.

target.comment:
VERIFIED OMOP mapping for sleep duration.
- OMOP concept_id: 40771110
- Domain: Measurement
- Unit_concept_id: 8505 (hour) or 8550 (minute)
- Recommended: 7-9 hours for adults (AASM guidelines)

Sleep quality assessment. No direct OMOP concept.
Can be represented via:
- PSQI score (Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index)
- Vendor-specific sleep scores (Oura, WHOOP)
Store in measurement_source_value with context.

GAP: Sleep efficiency has no OMOP concept.
Formula: (Total Sleep Time / Time in Bed) × 100
Normal: >85%
Unit: percentage (%)
Critical metric for insomnia assessment.

GAP: Sleep onset latency has no OMOP concept.
Time from lights out to sleep onset.
Normal: <30 minutes
Prolonged latency indicates insomnia.
Unit_concept_id: 8550 (minute)
Number of wake episodes during sleep period. Normal: <5 brief awakenings.

unmapped.display: No OMOP concept - requires custom vocabulary extension

Combines duration, efficiency, stages, HRV during sleep.
Examples: Oura Sleep Score, WHOOP Sleep Performance, Fitbit Sleep Score.
